Setting Password Properties

You can set the password expiration time limit and the length of the password required to access a particular server configuration. These password properties apply to all user accounts on a server configuration.

Changes made to password length take effect immediately and apply to all new user accounts or new passwords. However, current users will still be able to use their existing passwords.

Changes made to the password expiration times take effect after the appropriate time interval. Users will be prompted to change their passwords two weeks before suspension takes place. The only user account not subject to expiration is the Administrator account.

By default, strong passwords are turned off. When turned on, users must provide strong passwords when they change passwords, regardless of the reason for the change.

Note: This function can be performed only for servers that are currently running.

To set password constraints:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the System Policy shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > System Policy.

    The System Policy dialog opens.

  4. On the Passwords tab, select one of the following password expiration options:

    • Passwords never expire.

    • Passwords expire after ___ days. Enter the number of days a password will be valid.

  5. Select the Require strong passwords check box to require passwords to meet all of the following criteria:

    • New password must be different from the old password.

    • New password must be different from the user name.

    • New password must be mixed case, containing at least one lowercase and at least one uppercase alphabetical character (English alphabet as determined by ASCII value of the character).

    • New password must contain at least one non-alphabetical character.

    Selecting this check box changes the value in the Minimum Password Length ___ text box to 3. You can increase it if you choose.

  6. (Optional) Enter a minimum password length. The default, zero (0), allows blank passwords. The maximum password length is 32 characters.

  7. Click OK.
